200.description: The user who will receive a welcome email.

parameters.name: change_password
parameters.description: Used for changing a password on an existing user.

parameters.name: change_password_confirmation
parameters.description: Optional, but if provided, we will ensure that it matches the value sent in `change_password`.

parameters.name: grant_permission
parameters.description: Permission to grant on the user root.  Can be blank or `full`, `read`, `write`, `preview`, or `history`.

parameters.name: group_ids
parameters.description: A list of group ids to associate this user with.  Comma delimited.

parameters.name: password_confirmation
parameters.description: Optional, but if provided, we will ensure that it matches the value sent in `password`.

parameters.name: allowed_ips
parameters.description: A list of allowed IPs if applicable.  Newline delimited

parameters.name: attachments_permission
parameters.description: Can the user create Bundles (aka Share Links)?  This field will be aliased or renamed in the future to `bundles_permission`.

parameters.name: authenticate_until
parameters.description: Scheduled Date/Time at which user will be deactivated

parameters.name: authentication_method
parameters.description: How is this user authenticated?  One of `password`, `ldap`, or `sso`

parameters.name: bypass_site_allowed_ips
parameters.description: Allow this user to skip site-wide IP blacklists?

parameters.name: dav_permission
parameters.description: Can the user connect with WebDAV?

parameters.name: ftp_permission
parameters.description: Can the user access with FTP/FTPS?

parameters.name: notes
parameters.description: Any internal notes on the user

parameters.name: password_validity_days
parameters.description: Number of days to allow user to use the same password

parameters.name: receive_admin_alerts
parameters.description: Should the user receive admin alerts such a certificate expiration notifications and overages?

parameters.name: require_password_change
parameters.description: Is a password change required upon next user login?

parameters.name: restapi_permission
parameters.description: Can this user access the REST API?

parameters.name: self_managed
parameters.description: Does this user manage it's own credentials or is it a shared/bot user?

parameters.name: sftp_permission
parameters.description: Can the user access with SFTP?

parameters.name: site_admin
parameters.description: Is the user an administrator for this site?

parameters.name: ssl_required
parameters.description: SSL required setting. Can be `system_setting`, `always_require`, or `never_require`.

parameters.name: sso_strategy_id
parameters.description: SSO (Single Sign On) strategy ID for the user, if applicable.

parameters.name: subscribe_to_newsletter
parameters.description: Is the user subscribed to the newsletter?

parameters.name: user_root
parameters.description: Root folder for FTP (and optionally SFTP if the appropriate site-wide setting is set.)  Note that this is not used for API, Desktop, or Web interface.

post.description: Unlock user who has been locked out due to failed logins.

parameters.name: welcome_email_enabled
parameters.description: Will the welcome email be sent to new users?

parameters.name: ask_about_overwrites
parameters.description: If false, rename conflicting files instead of asking for overwrite confirmation.  Only applies to web interface.

parameters.name: show_request_access_link
parameters.description: Show request access link for users without access?  Currently unused.

parameters.name: welcome_email_cc
parameters.description: Include this email in welcome emails if enabled

parameters.name: welcome_custom_text
parameters.description: Custom text send in user welcome email

parameters.name: windows_mode_ftp
parameters.description: Does FTP user Windows emulation mode?

parameters.name: desktop_app_session_ip_pinning
parameters.description: Is desktop app session IP pinning enabled?

parameters.name: ssl_required
parameters.description: Is SSL required?  Disabling this is insecure.

parameters.name: user_lockout
parameters.description: Will users be locked out after incorrect login attempts?

parameters.name: user_lockout_tries
parameters.description: Number of login tries within `user_lockout_within` hours before users are locked out

parameters.name: user_lockout_within
parameters.description: Number of hours for user lockout window

parameters.name: user_lockout_lock_period
parameters.description: How many hours to lock user out for failed password?

parameters.name: include_password_in_welcome_email
parameters.description: Include password in emails to new users?

parameters.name: days_to_retain_backups
parameters.description: Number of days to keep deleted files

parameters.description: Number of prior passwords to disallow

parameters.name: password_validity_days
parameters.description: Number of days password is valid

parameters.name: password_require_mixed

parameters.name: sftp_user_root_enabled
parameters.description: Use user FTP roots also for SFTP?

parameters.name: session_pinned_by_ip
parameters.description: Are sessions locked to the same IP? (i.e. do users need to log in again if they change IPs?)

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Internal name for key.  For your reference only.

parameters.name: permission_set
parameters.description: Leave blank, or set to `desktop_app` to restrict the key to only desktop app functions.

parameters.name: expires_at
parameters.description: Have the key expire at this date/time.

200.description: A list of api key objects.

parameters.name: otp
parameters.description: Current value of OTP, Yubikey string, or U2F response value.  U2F response value requires a json stringified object containing fields `clientData`, `keyHandle`, and `signatureData`.

parameters.name: method_type
parameters.description: One of: u2f, sms, totp, yubi

post.description: Generate (and send if applicable) a one time password for current user's primary 2FA method.

parameters.name: u2f_only
parameters.description: Set to `true` to only generate an OTP for U2F (FIDO) keys and skip things like SMS.

200.description: A list of u2f sign requests.

delete.description: Delete current API key.  (Requires current API connection to be using an API key.)

204.description: Delete current API key.  (Requires current API connection to be using an API key.)

patch.description: Update current API key.  (Requires current API connection to be using an API key.)

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Internal name for key.  For your reference only.

parameters.name: permission_set
parameters.description: Leave blank, or set to `desktop_app` to restrict the key to only desktop app functions.

parameters.name: expires_at
parameters.description: Have the key expire at this date/time.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Internal name for key.  For your reference only.

parameters.name: permission_set
parameters.description: Leave blank, or set to 'desktop_app' to restrict the key to only desktop app functions.

parameters.name: expires_at
parameters.description: Have the key expire at this date/time.

parameters.name: otp
parameters.description: If this user has a 2FA device, provide its OTP or code here.

post.description: Send email(s) with a link to bundle

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: A list of email addresses to share this bundle with.

204.description: Send email(s) with a link to bundle

parameters.name: paths
parameters.description: A list of paths to include in this bundle.

put.description: Upload file to existing path (replace file)

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: The action to perform.  Can be append, attachment, end, upload, put, or may not exist

parameters.name: mkdir_parents
parameters.description: Create parent directories if they do not exist?

parameters.name: structure
parameters.description: If copying folder, copy just the structure?

parameters.name: with_rename
parameters.description: Allow file rename instead of overwrite?

201.description: This method returns multiple types.  If the action is put, upload, or append it will return a file upload object.  If the action is move or copy, no body will be returned.  If a new object is created the status code will be 201, otherwise it will be 200.

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: Action to take.  Can be `count`, `count_nrs` (non recursive), `size`, `permissions`, or blank.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Specify to filter folders/files list by name.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Number of folders/files to show per page.

parameters.name: preview_size
parameters.description: Request a preview size.  Can be `small` (default), `large`, `xlarge`, or `pdf`.

200.description: If `action` is `count` or `count_nrs`, returns a folder count object.  If `action` is `size`, returns a folder size object.  If `action` is `permissions`, returns a list of permissions.  Otherwise, returns a list of file stat objects for the specified path.

admin_group_ids.description: List of group IDs of which this user is an administrator

allowed_ips.description: A list of allowed IPs if applicable.  Newline delimited

attachments_permission.description: Can the user create Bundles (aka Share Links)?  This field will be aliased or renamed in the future to `bundles_permission`.

authenticate_until.description: Scheduled Date/Time at which user will be deactivated

authentication_method.description: How is this user authenticated?  One of `password`, `ldap`, or `sso`

bypass_site_allowed_ips.description: Allow this user to skip site-wide IP blacklists?

dav_permission.description: Can the user connect with WebDAV?

ftp_permission.description: Can the user access with FTP/FTPS?

group_ids.description: List of group IDs of which this user is a member

last_protocol_cipher.description: The last protocol and cipher used

lockout_expires.description: Time in the future that the user will no longer be locked out if applicable

notes.description: Any internal notes on the user

password_set_at.description: Last time the user's password was set

password_validity_days.description: Number of days to allow user to use the same password

public_keys_count.description: Number of public keys associated with this user

receive_admin_alerts.description: Should the user receive admin alerts such a certificate expiration notifications and overages?

require_password_change.description: Is a password change required upon next user login?

restapi_permission.description: Can this user access the REST API?

self_managed.description: Does this user manage it's own credentials or is it a shared/bot user?

sftp_permission.description: Can the user access with SFTP?

site_admin.description: Is the user an administrator for this site?

ssl_required.description: SSL required setting. Can be `system_setting`, `always_require`, or `never_require`.

sso_strategy_id.description: SSO (Single Sign On) strategy ID for the user, if applicable.

subscribe_to_newsletter.description: Is the user subscribed to the newsletter?

externally_managed.description: Is this user managed by an external source (such as LDAP)?

type_of_2fa.description: Type(s) of 2FA methods in use.  Will be either `sms`, `totp`, `u2f`, `yubi`, or multiple values sorted alphabetically and joined by an underscore.

user_root.description: Root folder for FTP (and optionally SFTP if the appropriate site-wide setting is set.)  Note that this is not used for API, Desktop, or Web interface.

permission.description: Permission type.  Can be full, readonly, writeonly, previewonly, or history

recursive.description: Does this permission apply to subfolders?

created_at.description: Time which API Key was created

name.description: Internal name for the API Key.  For your use.

permission_set.description: Permissions for this API Key.  Will be either `full` or `desktop_app`.  Keys with the `desktop_app` permission set only have the ability to do the functions provided in our Desktop App (File and Share Link operations.)  We hope to offer additional permission sets in the future, such as for a Site Admin to give a key with no administrator privileges.  If you have ideas for permission sets, please let us know.

platform.description: If this API key represents a Desktop app, what platform was it created on?

user_id.description: User ID for the owner of this API Key.  May be blank for Site-wide API Keys.

admin_ids.description: List of user IDs who are group administrators

user_ids.description: List of user IDs who belong to this group

usernames.description: List of usernames who belong to this group

MembershipEntity.description: Add a User to a Group.

notify_user_actions.description: Trigger notification on notification user actions?

notify_on_copy.description: Triggers notification when moving or copying files to this path

send_interval.description: The time interval that notifications are aggregated to.  Can be five_minutes, fifteen_minutes, hourly, or daily

unsubscribed.description: Is the user unsubscribed from this notification?

unsubscribed_reason.description: The reason that the user unsubscribed.  Can be none, unsubscribe_link_clicked, mail_bounced, or mail_marked_as_spam.

aws_access_key.description: AWS Access Key, if connecting to S3

aws_secret_key.description: AWS Secret Key, if connecting to S3

password.description: Remote server password.  For FTP or SFTP without private key authentication.

port.description: Port for remote server.  Not needed for S3.

private_key.description: Private key.  Needed for SFTP if authenticating via private key.

username.description: Remote server username.  Not needed for S3 buckets.

allowed_2fa_method_sms.description: Is SMS two factor authentication allowed?

allowed_2fa_method_totp.description: Is TOTP two factor authentication allowed?

allowed_2fa_method_u2f.description: Is U2F two factor authentication allowed?

allowed_2fa_method_yubi.description: Is yubikey two factor authentication allowed?

admin_user_id.description: User ID for the main site administrator

ask_about_overwrites.description: If false, rename conflicting files instead of asking for overwrite confirmation.  Only applies to web interface.

custom_namespace.description: Is this site using a custom namespace for users?

days_to_retain_backups.description: Number of days to keep deleted files

desktop_app_session_ip_pinning.description: Is desktop app session IP pinning enabled?

hipaa.description: Is there a signed HIPAA BAA between Files.com and this site?

include_password_in_welcome_email.description: Include password in emails to new users?

ldap_base_dn.description: Base DN for looking up users in LDAP server

ldap_domain.description: Domain name that will be appended to usernames

ldap_enabled.description: Main LDAP setting: is LDAP enabled?

ldap_group_action.description: Should we sync groups from LDAP server?

ldap_group_exclusion.description: Comma or newline separated list of group names (with optional wildcards) to exclude when syncing.

ldap_group_inclusion.description: Comma or newline separated list of group names (with optional wildcards) to include when syncing.

ldap_type.description: LDAP type.  Can be active_directory or open_ldap

ldap_user_action.description: Should we sync users from LDAP server?

ldap_user_include_groups.description: Comma or newline separated list of group names (with optional wildcards) - if provided, only users in these groups will be added or synced.

ldap_username.description: Username for signing in to LDAP server.

ldap_username_field.description: LDAP username field.  Can be SAMAccountName or userPrincipalName

max_prior_passwords.description: Number of prior passwords to disallow

overage_notified_at.description: Last time the site was notified about an overage

password_require_mixed.description: Require lower and upper case letters in passwords?

password_validity_days.description: Number of days password is valid

require_2fa.description: Require two-factor authentication for all users?

require_2fa_stop_time.description: If set, requirement for two-factor authentication has been scheduled to end on this date-time.

session_pinned_by_ip.description: Are sessions locked to the same IP? (i.e. do users need to log in again if they change IPs?)

sftp_user_root_enabled.description: Use user FTP roots also for SFTP?

show_request_access_link.description: Show request access link for users without access?  Currently unused.

smtp_from.description: From address to use when mailing through custom SMTP

ssl_required.description: Is SSL required?  Disabling this is insecure.

switch_to_plan_date.description: If switching plans, when does the new plan take effect?

trial_days_left.description: Number of days left in trial

trial_until.description: When does this Site trial expire?

updated_at.description: Last time this Site was updated

use_provided_modified_at.description: Allow uploaders to set `provided_modified_at` for uploaded files?

user_lockout.description: Will users be locked out after incorrect login attempts?

user_lockout_lock_period.description: How many hours to lock user out for failed password?

user_lockout_tries.description: Number of login tries within `user_lockout_within` hours before users are locked out

user_lockout_within.description: Number of hours for user lockout window

welcome_custom_text.description: Custom text send in user welcome email

welcome_email_cc.description: Include this email in welcome emails if enabled

welcome_email_enabled.description: Will the welcome email be sent to new users?

windows_mode_ftp.description: Does FTP user Windows emulation mode?

login_token.description: Login token. If set, this token will allow your user to log in via browser at the domain in `login_token_domain`.

max_dir_listing_size.description: Maximum number of files to retrieve per folder for a directory listing.  This is based on the user's plan.

root_path.description: Initial root path to start the user's session in.

ssl_required.description: Is SSL required for this user?  (If so, ensure all your communications with this user use SSL.)

tls_disabled.description: Is strong TLS disabled for this user? (If this is set to true, the site administrator has signaled that it is ok to use less secure TLS versions for this user.)

two_factor_setup_needed.description: If true, this user needs to add a Two Factor Authentication method before performing any further actions.

allowed_2fa_method_sms.description: Sent only if 2FA setup is needed. Is SMS two factor authentication allowed?

allowed_2fa_method_totp.description: Sent only if 2FA setup is needed. Is TOTP two factor authentication allowed?

allowed_2fa_method_u2f.description: Sent only if 2FA setup is needed. Is U2F two factor authentication allowed?

allowed_2fa_method_yubi.description: Sent only if 2FA setup is needed. Is Yubikey two factor authentication allowed?

use_provided_modified_at.description: Allow the user to provide file/folder modified at dates?  If false, the server will always use the current date/time.

windows_mode_ftp.description: Does this user want to use Windows line-ending emulation?  (CR vs CRLF)

associated_with.description: The object that this public IP address list is associated with.  Can be Site, Site;expiring, Certificate, or Brick.

provision_groups.description: Auto-provision group membership based on group memberships on the SSO side?

provision_group_default.description: Comma-separated list of group names for groups to automatically add all auto-provisioned users to.

provision_group_exclusion.description: Comma-separated list of group names for groups (with optional wildcards) that will be excluded from auto-provisioning.

provision_group_inclusion.description: Comma-separated list of group names for groups (with optional wildcards) that will be auto-provisioned.

provision_group_required.description: Comma or newline separated list of group names (with optional wildcards) to require membership for user provisioning.

provision_time_zone.description: Default time zone for auto provisioned users.

destination_replace_from.description: If set, this string in the destination path will be replaced with the value in `destination_replace_to`.

destination_replace_to.description: If set, this string will replace the value `destination_replace_from` in the destination filename. You can use special patterns here.

interval.description: How often to run this automation?  One of: `day`, `week`, `week_end`, `month`, `month_end`, `quarter`, `quarter_end`, `year`, `year_end`

next_process_on.description: Date this automation will next run.

path.description: Path on which this Automation runs.  Supports globs.

realtime.description: Does this automation run in real time?  This is a read-only property based on automation type.

user_id.description: User ID of the Automation's creator.

user_ids.description: IDs of Users for the Automation (i.e. who to Request File from)

group_ids.description: IDs of Groups for the Automation (i.e. who to Request File from)

value.description: Settings for this behavior.  See the section above for an example value to provide here.  Formatting is different for each Behavior type.  May be sent as nested JSON or a single JSON-encoded string.  If using XML encoding for the API call, this data must be sent as a JSON-encoded string.

fields.description: A list of fields where errors occur

domains.description: Domains on this certificate other than files.com domains

brick_managed.description: Is this certificate automatically managed and renewed by Files.com?

ip_addresses.description: A list of IP addresses associated with this SSL Certificate

status.description: Certificate status (Request Generated, New, Active, Active/Expired, Expired, or Available)

destination.description: The destination path for this action, if applicable

ip.description: IP Address that performed this action

source.description: The source path for this action, if applicable

action.description: Type of action.  Can be `create`, `read`, `update`, `destroy`, `move`, `login`, `failedlogin`, `copy`, `user_create`, `user_update`, `user_destroy`, `group_create`, `group_update`, `group_destroy`, `permission_create`, `permission_destroy`, `api_key_create`, `api_key_update`, or `api_key_destroy`

failure_type.description: Failure type.  If action was a user login or session failure, why did it fail?  Can be `expired_trial`, `account_overdue`, `locked_out`, `ip_mismatch`, `password_mismatch`, `site_mismatch`, `username_not_found`, `none`, `no_ftp_permission`, `no_web_permission`, `no_directory`, `errno_enoent`, `no_sftp_permission`, `no_dav_permission`, `no_restapi_permission`, `key_mismatch`, `region_mismatch`, or `expired_access`

interface.description: Interface on which this action occurred.

admin.description: Is this user an administrator of this group?

usernames.description: A list of usernames for users in this group

setup_expires_at.description: 2fa setup expires at this date/time (typically 10 minutes after a new method is created)

U2fSignRequestEntity.description: Generate (and send if applicable) a one time password for current user's primary 2FA method.

code.description: Bundle code.  This code forms the end part of the Public URL.

description.example: The public description of the bundle.

paths.description: A list of filenames in this bundle

note.example: The internal note on the bundle.

mtime.description: File last modified date/time, according to the server.  This is the timestamp of the last Files.com operation of the file, regardless of what modified timestamp was sent.

provided_mtime.description: File last modified date/time, according to the client who set it.  Files.com allows desktop, FTP, SFTP, and WebDAV clients to set modified at times.  This allows Desktop<->Cloud syncing to preserve modified at times.

crc32.description: File CRC32 checksum. This is sometimes delayed, so if you get a blank response, wait and try again.

md5.description: File MD5 checksum. This is sometimes delayed, so if you get a blank response, wait and try again.

permissions.description: A short string representing the current user's permissions.  Can be `r`,`w`,`p`, or any combination

subfolders_locked?.description: Are subfolders locked and unable to be modified?

download_uri.description: Link to download file. Provided only in response to a download request.

status.description: File preview status.  Can be invalid, not_generated, generating, complete, or file_too_large

type.description: File preview status.  Can be invalid, not_generated, generating, complete, or file_too_large

owner.description: Owner of lock.  This can be any arbitrary string.

token.description: Lock token.  Use to release lock.
